newsitem.title: USA: Dow tumbles after markets jolted by inflation data.
newsitem.headline: Dow tumbles after markets jolted by inflation data.

text.p: U.S. blue chips tumbled to steep losses on Friday after a surprising jump in wholesale prices forced investors to recast their outlook for inflation and interest rates.

The Dow industrials fell 148 points, or 2.3 percent, to close unofficially at 6392. The decline ranked as the eighth largest in point terms in the history of the average, although in percentage terms it fell far short of the top losses.
The sell-off left the Dow some 134 points lower for the week, the fifth week in a row the average showed a loss.
